meaningMnemonic: There are <radical>fingers</radical> reaching towards you asking you to <radical>accept</radical> to <kanji>instruct</kanji> them. They're the fingers of students. And you're the teacher. See them reach out for knowledge. They want to accept this knowledge into their hearts and brains. Instruct them!
readingMnemonic: "Yes! I will <kanji>instruct</kanji> you, my dear students!" you cry, "I will instruct you on how to open a small <reading>ju</reading>ice (じゅ) box!" That's right. These little kids need help learning how to open small juice boxes (small because kids are small).
